Where I study

My four years of college were (still are) spent in Carnegie Mellon University.

I am a senoir majoring in

  • Computer Science,

    The courses I took that are related to CS:

    • 15-451 Algorithm Design and Analysis
    • 15-440 Distributed Systems
      1. Coursework: Distributed Bitcoin Miner. Implemented the Live Sequence Protocol by creating a system that can handle lost, duplicated, or corrupted Internet packets, as well as dealing with failing clients and servers by exponential back-off approach.
      2. Coursework: The Raft Consenses Algorithm. Implemented the replicated state machine protocol. Replication allows the service to continue operating even if some of its replicas experience failures.
    • 15-414 Bug Catching
    • 15-330 Introduction to Computer Security
    • 15-213 Introduction to Computer Systems
      1. Coursework: Proxy Lab. Implemented a web proxy server that acts as an intermediary between clients and servers with cache features to store uri and server reponses
      2. Coursework: Malloc Lab. Implemented a dynamic memory allocator which uses a list of doubly linked segregated list to store free memory blocks.
    • 16-385 Computer Vision
    • 10-315 Introduction to Machine Learning

and double majoring in

  • Statistics

    • 36-401 Modern Regression
    • 36-226 Introduction to Statistical Inferences
    • 36-225 Introduction to Probability Theory
